Description: Shoulder fragment of small East Greek pottery closed vessel. On unslipped exterior, a wavy line; two bands below. Incised inscription.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit: 'Compare an oinochoe from Clazomenae with a wavy line on its shoulder and a band at the widest part of vessel (Berlin 4949 [CVA Germany 33: pl.180 figs.7-8], given as North Ionian[?]).'
Seemingly not from the same vase as Leiden T.2489.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 53, no. 184 pl. 43)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.604)
